Story: I stared at my phone, heart pounding, as I replayed the conversation with Mark in my head. I knew I needed to call him right now, to apologize and explain myself before the misunderstanding grew. That’s what friends do—communicate, clear the air, make things right. If I didn’t leave now, I’d be late to the site, and rushing meant risking mistakes—dangerous ones. My crew counted on me to set the example, to keep everyone safe. My hands trembled, torn between dialing Mark’s number and grabbing my tool belt. The weight of both roles pressed down on me, each demanding my full attention, each too important to ignore.
